nodes.documentation:
@notice This function closes the pool, simulating one month has passed.
A winner should have been chosen and they had the interest transfered to them.
20 represents a 5% interest rate from the entire pool. Here it is hard coded, but would be where a call to
a Compound contract would make sense.
@dev Need to add the modifier requiredTimePassed to the end of the function header.
Additionally, a new instance of the PrizedLinkedContract should be created to start up a new pool,
yet keeping the current savers in the pool.
nodes.name: closePool

nodes.documentation: @notice This function is the circuit breaker function using a ternary.

nodes.documentation:
@notice This function closes the pool, simulating one month has passed.
A winner should have been chosen and they had the interest transfered to them.
20 represents a 5% interest rate from the entire pool. Here it is hard coded, but would be where a call to
a Compound contract would make sense.
@dev Need to add the modifier requiredTimePassed to the end of the function header.
Additionally, a new instance of the PrizedLinkedContract should be created to start up a new pool,
yet keeping the current savers in the pool.
nodes.name: closePool

nodes.documentation: @notice This function is the circuit breaker function using a ternary.
nodes.name: togglePause

devdoc.author: Brennan Fife
devdoc.details: This is the barebones for a prize-linked lottery system. Eventually, this contract would look to add additional features, including: Adding compadability with Coinbase Wallet, using Compound Finance for lending + Dai, and Rhombus Network to provide us with uniformly random numbers.

addToPool().details: The first require statement means to only add this entrant to potential winners if their current balance 0.

closePool().details: Need to add the modifier requiredTimePassed to the end of the function header. Additionally, a new instance of the PrizedLinkedContract should be created to start up a new pool, yet keeping the current savers in the pool.

lockPool().details: For testing purposes, the require statement has been taken out.

withdrawAll().details: This function currently withdraws ALL of the user's savings balance.

devdoc.title: The PrizedLinkedContract.sol contract for DOXA

addToPool().notice: This function adds new entrants to the current pool. An entrant can only join when the isOpen = true.

chooseWinner().notice: This function randomly chooses the winner from the current savers. It will make sure the current pool is locked.

closePool().notice: This function closes the pool, simulating one month has passed. A winner should have been chosen and they had the interest transfered to them. 20 represents a 5% interest rate from the entire pool. Here it is hard coded, but would be where a call to a Compound contract would make sense.

lockPool().notice: This function locks the pool 2 weeks after it is created. After pool is locked, the next two weeks will allow it to accrue interest.

togglePause().notice: This function is the circuit breaker function using a ternary.

viewDeposit().notice: This function allows users to see how much is in their savings.

withdrawAll().notice: This function withdraws their savings from the current pool.

userdoc.notice: PrizedLinkedContract is the main contract for our system. Users will be able to save money every month, with each month raffling off the interest generated from the collective pool of savers.
